name: CWverse
description: A consolidated galaxy of live-action DC shows from The CW network. It includes the core 'Arrowverse' and other interconnected series like 'Smallville' and 'Superman & Lois', which were linked via multiverse crossover events.

media.name: Smallville
media.timeline_note: Exists on its own Earth (Earth-167). Its characters and world were officially brought into the Arrowverse's multiverse during the 'Crisis on Infinite Earths' crossover event.

media.name: Arrow
media.timeline_note: The foundational show of the Arrowverse, set on Earth-1.

media.name: The Flash
media.timeline_note: The first direct spin-off from 'Arrow', also set on Earth-1.

media.name: Constantine
media.timeline_note: Originally an NBC show, the character was integrated into the Arrowverse on Earth-1 after its cancellation, becoming a regular on 'Legends of Tomorrow'.

media.name: Supergirl
media.timeline_note: Began on its own Earth (Earth-38) and later merged with Earth-1 to become Earth-Prime after 'Crisis on Infinite Earths'.

media.name: Black Lightning
media.timeline_note: Began on its own separate Earth and was merged into Earth-Prime after 'Crisis on Infinite Earths'.

media.name: Titans
media.timeline_note: A separate universe (Earth-9) that was officially acknowledged during the 'Crisis on Infinite Earths' crossover.

media.name: Doom Patrol
media.timeline_note: A separate universe (Earth-21) that was officially acknowledged during the 'Crisis on Infinite Earths' crossover.

media.name: Stargirl
media.timeline_note: Set on the post-Crisis Earth-2. While connected to the multiverse, it remains in its own continuity.

media.name: Superman & Lois
media.timeline_note: Initially presented as a direct spin-off set on Earth-Prime, this series was later retconned to be in its own separate universe.

relationships.reason: The CWverse concluded prior to the launch of the new DCU.
